name: Beacon Hotel

reviews.text: Just got back from south beach, and the beacon hotel was great. The service from the staff was excellent, willing to help with any questions we had. The room was nice. Yes it is small, that is the first thing you notice, but it has all that you need for your stay. The beds were amazing and the shower heads in the bathroom were really nice. Oh ya, they have an iPod docking station so you can listent to your music too, nice touch.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect, just cross the street and the beach is right there...and it's such a nice beach, warm, clear, turquiose water. You are right in the heart of the nightlife, everything was in walking distance. Although this time of year is their quietest - we didn't mind it at all...means no line ups waiting for a table!
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shopping was great too. Took the bus $1.50 to Aventura mall, it's about 1hr ride. Took a cab on the way back, and that was $40, but so much faster.
reviews.title: Incredible

likes.liked: — Our upgraded room and its open feeling
likes.disliked: — Only one shelf inside the shower - that's it!

reviews.text: Overall, loved it and will definitely go back and recommend the beacon hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here for one night. We had just concluded a Miami cruise, so we arrived around 10 am. The staff did everything possible to get our room ready as quickly as possible. They gave us an extra set of breakfast vouchers to use at the Johnny Rockets next door, which pays for a simple cereal and toast meal.
reviews.title: Beacon Hotel

likes.liked: — Classy rooms, clean and very well maintained

reviews.text: Yes, indeed the Beacon is from the Art Deco era and was built back in the 1930’s. It has been recently renovated but it does still have the art deco feeling. The space is small, the elevator was tiny fitting about 2 average size people and their luggage (there is only 2 floors so taking the stairs was not an effort) but the rooms were fine. We found them clean, spacious and updated. The beds were comfortable, linins were of high quality, an alarm clock with IPOD attachment and nice flat screen TV! The bathroom was very small, no fan and didn’t have a window that opened. There was a mirror in the bathroom and another full length mirror on the other side of the room but there was not an electrical outlet anywhere close to that mirror thus making hair drying difficult. [-] This is by far not a luxurious hotel but you get what you pay for and South Beach is an expensive destination. The location of the hotel couldn’t of been better. It was right in the middle of the main strip that faces the ocean (Ocean Drive) Everything is walking distance and there are a plethora of bars, clubs and restaurants to by sampled while visiting. The beach is right across the street. Chairs and Umbrellas can be rented there for under $20 for the day. Upon check in you received coupons for free breakfast at Johnny Rockets right next door for each morning of your stay. As mentioned by other reviewers the hotel doesn’t have parking but does offer Valet service which we found well worth it. The hotel staff couldn’t of been more pleasant and accommodating. During our stay we were heading out for the night and as we passed the front desk to walk out the door it started down pouring. The front desk handed us a complimentary umbrella for our walk. Later that same evening while arriving home my friend had suffered a deep cut from attempting to pick up a broken glass. The font desk worker spayed antiseptic on my friends cut and bandaged her up all with a smile. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is there just to sleep and get ready. Again, the location is perfect, their prices are average, it’s clean, exceptional service and comfy beds – it’s not a hotel room you would want to hang out in.
reviews.title: Great Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Beacon for the first two nights of our honeymoon and after getting home a week later, I was surprised to find a small charge of around $9.00 had been placed against the credit card that I used to pay for my stay. I had to place two phone calls before someone in the Beacon Hotel called me back and they claimed that the fee was for our use of item(s) in the mini bar in the room. Of course this wouldv'e made sense had we actually even opened the mini bar, but we hadn't and this shouldv'e been pretty obvious by the unbroken seal that was on the mini bar door. Needless to say, the hotel refunded the money back onto my credit card after I raised a stink, but I have to wonder how often this little scam works and how many people don't bother to question the small charge.
reviews.title: Better check your bill!

likes.disliked: — Issues over billing after my returm home

reviews.text: The pictures and other reviews made this hotel seem awesome and we were really excited to go. Yes, it is definitely art deco but everything is small. First, we ran into this tiny elevator that took forever to come down and there was no way that we were fitting in there with the bellhop so we decided to climb the stairs. There's a funky smell in the hotel. We finally get up to our room and it is tiny. They must have taken pictures with a panaromic lens or something! Floors are dirty, bathroom STINKS, and we asked for a oceanfront view which would be weird since the ocean apparently was across the street, but we faced another building anyway. So it was not great. The hotel staff was very polite. There is no place to park so you valet and they told us that it would take 20 minutes to get a car so we had to tell them in advance. I'm sure there are nicer places to stay. The stop was prime but I'd rather walk a bit and stay somewhere clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Not Worth It!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I had an outstanding stay at the beacon. The service is impecable. I will stay there every time I go to Miami. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay pleasurable.
reviews.title: Loved the Beacon!!

likes.liked: — the staff went above and beyond to make sure my stay was pleasureable

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I had a great stay at the Beacon Hotel. The service was phenomenal and we were treated very well. We were able to check in early (arriving at 9:30AM instead of 3PM) which helped A LOT. The front desk staff was very helpful throughout our stay giving us ideas on restaurants, bars, clubs & lounges to go to. The room was a little small but the beds were very comfortable, the room was clean and the free Aveda products we were able to use were nice! There was plenty of room for 3 girls to get ready for the evenings without feeling cramped. The location of the Beacon was perfect. Right across the street from the beach, right on the strip with all the cute little cafe's and within close proximity of nightlife. I went to Miami in March of 2007 and stayed at a 5 star resort which cost a FORTUNE and it was nice, but the Beacon was comparable in service and the location was even better.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is relatively clean but could be much better...the rooms are tiny tiny small. Basically you can not let your suitcase open on the floor.
reviews.title: not worth the price at all

reviews.text: The staff is ok and the location is great. There is a restaurant on the first floor of the hotel but the breakfast is served next door at johny rockets wich is for me an extremly cheap attitude for the high price you pay.
reviews.title: Try the Beacon if you want art deco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also watch your bill they attend to charge you for stuff you haven't use at the minibar. Good spirit...in summary we paid $230for a room that is worth $150 because of the location not because of the comfort.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently visited South Beach prior to a cruise. I had stayed at the Beacon before and was very pleased, so decided to return, even though the price had gone way up in two years. This time there were three of us, my daughter, my granddaughter and myself, and the room was very crowded. The rooms are spotlessly clean and nicely furnished, but small. The bathroom is tiny and there's no place to put your toiletries. Also the door to the bathroom was glass so not much privacy. The beds are very comfortable, and in addition to a flat screen TV there's an iron, ironing board and a new addition, chairs to take to the beach.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We wanted to enjoy the ambience of being in an art deco hotel and right in the middle of the excitement of South Beach so it was okay for a short stay, but for a vacation I would look for a room with more space and a larger bath. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, check-in time is 3:00 P.M. and both times I have stayed there we couldn't get into the room until after lunch, which cuts down on your time on the beach. So for a lot of money you don't really get a full day. We enjoyed our stay and I would recommend the Beacon for a unique experience.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: I was planning a weekend at the Beacon Hotel in Miami over the memorial day weekend holiday, and an unforseen medical emergency came up and I was not able to go. The staff was more than helpful to refund my room, which i had to cancel the night before my expected arrival. I must say I will stay at the beacon, if for not any other reason, because of the first class customer service.
reviews.title: Unbelievable Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel to stay at, located right in the middle of the strip, near all the restaurants, and entertainment of South Beach. The service at this hotel is comparable to those at five star hotels. If you are looking for an excellent place to stay in South Beach then I recommend the Beacon.
reviews.title: Great Location!!! Excellent Service

likes.liked: — The Beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in.

reviews.title: BUGS BUGS BUGS!!!!
reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine, (until the bugs) nothing too great about it but it made up for it in location. It is right on the strip and in the midst of all the other hotels in restaurants. It is a little outdated, but they are SLOWLY renovating the rooms.

The problem: We encountered a couple of ants in our room the 2nd night we were there, and of course killed them. By the 3rd night they were all over the room. We called the maitenance people and they checked it out and decided it was so bad we needed to change rooms....That was great....They put us in a nicer room and promised we would be refunded some money....Well when we asked about our refund they offered us 25% off of one night and that was it....Clearly, not the service you expect from a 4 star hotel, especially since we had to change floors and move our luggage ourselves. We were very upset by this and with much negotiation we were told 50% off of one night but it would go through once the hotel manager was in, which was not until we had departed.....We left multiple messages for him, and when someone finally called us back they told us that there was only 1 ant seen in our room and we would not receive a refund. Clearly that was not the case since we had to change rooms. We fought for about an hour with the hotel management and finally decided it wasn't worth the $50 or so dollars and have given up......Needless to say, the service is AWFUL and the hotel much below par.
reviews.title: Nice, but there are better out there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful Location; right across the street from the beach and down the street from descent shopping.
reviews.title: The Beacon Doesn't Honour Reservations!

description: The Beacon Hotel is a gem among boutique South Beach hotels in Miami. Besides its premium location right in the center of Ocean Drive, and beautifully remodeled rooms and lobby, the Beacon gives you South Beach how it is meant to be experienced. Here, you have direct access to seven miles of sand and surf, unrivaled nightlife, premier shopping and dining. Enjoy infinite views of the Atlantic Ocean on one side and historical sherbet-colored Art Deco architecture on the other. Be it honeymoon, anniversary or a romantic beach getaway, this historical oceanfront boutique hotel is a haven for a perfect romantic vacation. Beacon Hotel offers complimentary breakfast, free Wi-Fi, and complimentary beach towels and beach chairs in the room.
